support_summary: A core autophagy-initiating kinase that contains a LIR motif and directly interacts with LC3B. This interaction is part of a regulatory feedback loop where it can recruit ULK1 to the phagophore and LC3B can also negatively regulate ULK1 activity.

functions.cellular_process: The direct binding of LC3B to the LC3-interacting region (LIR) motif within ULK1 serves as a negative feedback mechanism. As autophagosomes form and LC3B-II accumulates, this interaction suppresses the kinase activity of the ULK1 complex.
functions.effect_description: The kinase activity of ULK1 is suppressed, providing a negative feedback mechanism to control the rate of autophagy initiation and prevent excessive autophagy.
biological_consequence: LC3B-II accumulates on mature autophagosomes → LC3B-II binds to the LIR motif within the ULK1 complex → ULK1 kinase activity is allosterically inhibited → Suppression of new autophagy initiation events → Negative feedback loop terminates the autophagy response
specific_effects: LC3B acts as a negative regulator of ULK1 activity
The interaction is mediated by the LIR motif in ULK1
This feedback loop helps to terminate the autophagy response once it has been initiated

evidence.paper_title: GABARAPs and LC3s have opposite roles in regulating ULK1 for autophagy induction
evidence.authors: Grunwald J, Nguyen T, Shim J, Lee D, Lickwar CR, Yueh A, Youle RJ, Kuhlman B, Oh S
evidence.assay: In vitro kinase assay, Cellular assays
evidence.relevant_quote: By reconstituting ATG8-depleted cells with individual ATG8 members, we identified GABARAP and GABARAPL1 as positive and LC3B and LC3C as negative regulators of ULK1 activity.

evidence.paper_title: Molecular determinants regulating selective binding of autophagy adapters and receptors to ATG8 proteins
evidence.authors: Wirth M, Zhang W, Laly AC, Wipf P, Brodsky JL, Schurdak M, Galli P, Joosten RP, Alemu EA, Waguri S, Mizushima N, Tooze SA, Perlmutter DH, Gibert M, Proikas-Cezanne T, Eskelinen EL, Johansen T, Reggiori F, Behrends C
evidence.relevant_quote: The C-terminal region is critical for ULK1 LC3-interacting region (LIR) binding specificity... peptide array of 24-mer ULK1 peptide covering LIR motif incubated with... GST-LC3B...

functions.cellular_process: The interaction between the LIR motif in ULK1 and lipidated LC3B (LC3-II) on the forming autophagosome membrane helps to recruit and tether the ULK1 initiation complex to the site of autophagosome formation.
functions.effect_description: The ULK1 initiation complex is localized to the growing autophagosome membrane, concentrating its kinase activity at the site of action to promote efficient phagophore elongation.
biological_consequence: Autophagy induction (e.g., mTORC1 inhibition) → ULK1 complex activation → Initial LC3B lipidation on the nascent phagophore → ULK1 binds to lipidated LC3B via its LIR motif → ULK1 complex is tethered to the site of autophagosome formation → Spatial regulation of autophagy initiation
specific_effects: Facilitates the association of the ULK1 complex with forming autophagosomes
Depends on the LIR motif within ULK1 and lipidated LC3B
Contributes to the spatial regulation of autophagy initiation

evidence.paper_title: The LIR motif – crucial for selective autophagy
evidence.relevant_quote: We identified that the same LIR motif in ULK1 is required for its starvation-induced association with autophagosomes.

evidence.paper_title: A Mammalian Mitophagy Receptor, Bcl2-L-13, Recruits the ULK1 Complex to Induce Mitophagy
evidence.authors: Murakawa T, Yamaguchi O, Hashimoto A, Hikoso S, Takeda T, Oka T, Yasui H, Taneike M, Nakayama H, Nishida K, Takeda K, Mizushima N, Sakata Y, Otsu K
evidence.relevant_quote: ...immunoprecipitated with anti-HA antibody. Co-precipitated endogenous ULK1 and LC3B were detected by immunoblotting.

mechanism: The direct binding of LC3B to the LC3-interacting region (LIR) motif within ULK1 serves as a negative feedback mechanism. As autophagosomes form and LC3B-II accumulates, this interaction suppresses the kinase activity of the ULK1 complex. The interaction between the LIR motif in ULK1 and lipidated LC3B (LC3-II) on the forming autophagosome membrane helps to recruit and tether the ULK1 initiation complex to the site of autophagosome formation.
effect: The kinase activity of ULK1 is suppressed, providing a negative feedback mechanism to control the rate of autophagy initiation and prevent excessive autophagy.; The ULK1 initiation complex is localized to the growing autophagosome membrane, concentrating its kinase activity at the site of action to promote efficient phagophore elongation.
summary: LC3B inhibits ULK1 to regulate negative regulation of ulk1 kinase activity and ulk1 recruitment to phagophore, ultimately affecting negative feedback loop terminates the autophagy response.
